name: Blast Off!
description: Time to leave this forsaken planet!

quests.name: Breaking Down H2O
quests.description: You're going to need a system to create Rocket Fuel. The Electrolyser will separate water in Hydrogen and Oxygen which is needed for the Chemical Reactor Machine.

quests.name: Rocket Surgery
quests.description: On your launchpad, place your Thrusters, Fuel Tanks, Guidance Computer, Seat,and item storage. Make sure your Structural Tower is the proper height and not shorter than your rocket. Next, build your rocket using the Rocket Assembling Machine. After your rocket is built, shift right-click on your rocket and insert the Planetary Chip into the Guidance Computer. Next, push the "Select DST" button to set your destination to "Luna". Fuel your rocket,  get on the seat on launch!

quests.name: Suit Up
quests.description: You won't be able to last very long in space without a proper space suit. Craft one together and suit up for your mission outta this place!

quests.name: Top Off The Tanks
quests.description: Once you have your suit equipped and tanks for oxygen, use the Gas Charging Pad to directly transfer oxygen from your storage tanks into your suit.

quests.name: Ticket To The Skies
quests.description: After much consideration, getting off this planet might be a better idea. Maybe you can find a better home somewhere else! You'll first need to pull your Holo-Projector back out to begin planning out your new spaceport.

quests.name: Fill Her Up!
quests.description: The Fueling Station is the machine necessary to fuel your rockets on the launchpad.

quests.name: Precise Assembly
quests.description: Some of the items you'll need to get your space program running aren't able to be crafted by hand. The Precision Assembler will be your first step in crafting the smaller, complex materials.

quests.name: Suit Upgrades
quests.description: Use the Suit Workstation to upgrade and monitor the information on your space suit. You'll need to insert tanks of oxygen to be able to breathe while in space.

quests.name: Fueled Up And Ready!
quests.description: Collect a large quantity of Rocket Fuel to prepare yourself for take-off!

quests.name: Chemical Reactions
quests.description: The Chemical Reactor Takes Hydrogen and Oxygen and creates Rocket Fuel. This is needed to fuel your rockets before take-off.

quests.name: Preparing For Takeoff
quests.description: The Rocket Monitoring Station will needed for your upcoming launchpad. Use this machine to monitor the progress of rockets before and after launch.

quests.name: Launchpad Construction
quests.description: You can't just place a rocket down and take off from the dirt. Create a 5x5 rocket pad for take-off. Under the launchpad blocks, place vanilla glass. The Structure Tower needs to be placed down to the side of the launchpad. Place a block of glass in line with the glass under the launchpad blocks, and build the tower upwards. The bottom Structure Tower block should be directly next to a launchpad block. The Structure tower needs to be the same height or higher than the rocket on the launchpad to correctly build and launch. (FYI feed the T-Rex Redstone Blocks so it can grow!).

quests.name: Dueces!
quests.description: Now, the final step in your journey. Get in your rocket and fly off this forsaken planet. Leave it all behind and never look back. Good luck! (Make sure you have air so you don't die right away!)

quests.name: Assemblers Assemble!
quests.description: One of the final machines needed to take-off is the Rocket Assembling Machine. Once you place your rocket thrusters, guidance computer, storage, etc. on the launchpad use the Assembling Machine to scan and build the rocket into a single block. Place this machine near the launchpad and use the Linker item to link the Assembling, Fueling, Monitoring Station machines to each other.
